isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - Before 12/06/1994 - COMPONENTS

svcsubsecinfo.para: The heater only system is a unit of different construction from the Blend-Air System. The list of components is the same as the shared and heater portions of the combined system although the configuration of some of them is different. Since most are the same, the service of both will be covered as one, with exceptions noted where they occur.

The components discussed here are those of the in-cab heater and Blend-Air units only. For detailed information on the air conditioning system, refer to GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE, and AIR CONDITIONING COMPRESSOR AND CLUTCH in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

svcproc.title: HOT WATER VALVE (NOT USED WITH HEATER ONLY SYSTEM)
svcproc.para: The hot water valve (heater shut-off, Figure 3) is attached to the floor of the Blend-Air unit housing. It is placed in the heater core inlet hose and serves to meter the flow of hot engine coolant through the core. The flow control is accomplished by an adjustable link connecting the valve and the Blend-Air door, which in turn is controlled by a cable connected to the control panel HTR lever.
